
# mregions

[![cran
checks](https://cranchecks.info/badges/worst/mregions)](https://cranchecks.info/pkgs/mregions)
[![Build
Status](https://travis-ci.org/ropensci/mregions.svg)](https://travis-ci.org/ropensci/mregions)
[![codecov.io](https://codecov.io/github/ropensci/mregions/coverage.svg?branch=master)](https://codecov.io/github/ropensci/mregions?branch=master)
[![rstudio mirror
downloads](http://cranlogs.r-pkg.org/badges/mregions?color=FAB657)](https://github.com/r-hub/cranlogs.app)
[![cran
version](http://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/mregions)](https://cran.r-project.org/package=mregions)
[![](https://badges.ropensci.org/53_status.svg)](https://github.com/ropensci/software-review/issues/53)

`mregions` - Get data from <https://www.marineregions.org>

Some data comes from the [Flanders Marine Institute (VLIZ)
geoserver](http://geo.vliz.be/geoserver/web/)

`mregions` is useful to a wide diversity of R users because you get
access to all of the data MarineRegions has, which can help in a variety
of use cases:

-   Visualize marine regions alone
-   Visualize marine regions with associated data paired with analysis
-   Use marine region geospatial boundaries to query data providers
    (e.g., OBIS (<https://www.obis.org>))
-   Geocode - get geolocation data from place names
-   Reverse Geocode - get place names from geolocation data

## Install

``` r
install.packages("mregions")
install.packages("sf")
```

Development version

``` r
devtools::install_github("ropensci/mregions")
```

Load Libraries

``` r
library("mregions")
library("sf")

# helper library
library("leaflet")
```

## Get GeoJSON

#### example 1: Marine Ecoregions of the World (MEOW)

**Get Data**

Keys accessible from the [Flanders Marine Institute (VLIZ)
geoserver](http://geo.vliz.be/geoserver/web/).

``` r
ecoregions_geoJSON <- mr_geojson(key = "Ecoregions:ecoregions")
length(ecoregions_geoJSON$features)
#> [1] 50
```

**Plot Data**

50 features are loaded, therefore the result differs from the map
available on the
[geoserver](http://geo.vliz.be/geoserver/Ecoregions/wms?service=WMS&version=1.1.0&request=GetMap&layers=Ecoregions:ecoregions&styles=&bbox=-180.0,-89.9,180.0,86.919&width=768&height=377&srs=EPSG:4326&format=application/openlayers).

``` r
leaflet() %>%
  addProviderTiles(provider = 'OpenStreetMap') %>%
  addGeoJSON(geojson = ecoregions_geoJSON$features) %>%
  fitBounds(-160,-52,160,60)
```

![map1](tools/img/leaf1_ecoregions.png)

### example 2: Maritime Boundaries (EEZ)

**Get Data**

``` r
eezboundaries_geoJSON <- mr_geojson(key = "MarineRegions:eez_boundaries")
```

**Plot Data**

``` r
leaflet() %>%
  addProviderTiles(provider = 'OpenStreetMap') %>%
  addGeoJSON(geojson = eezboundaries_geoJSON$features) %>%
  fitBounds(-160,-52,160,60)
```

![map2](tools/img/leaf1_eezboundaries.png)

## Get Shape

#### example 1: Marine Ecoregions of the World (MEOW)

**Select region**

``` r
ecoregions_shp <- mr_shp(key = "Ecoregions:ecoregions", maxFeatures = 50)
class(ecoregions_shp)
#> [1] "sf"         "tbl_df"     "tbl"        "data.frame"
```

**Plot data**

``` r
leaflet() %>%
  addProviderTiles(provider = 'OpenStreetMap') %>%
  addPolygons(data = ecoregions_shp)
```

![map4](tools/img/leaf2_ecoregions.png)

#### example 2: Maritime Boundaries (EEZ)

**Select region**

``` r
eezboundaries_shp <- mr_shp(key = "MarineRegions:eez_boundaries", maxFeatures = 50)
```

**Plot data**

``` r
leaflet() %>%
  addProviderTiles(provider = 'OpenStreetMap') %>%
  addPolygons(data = eezboundaries_shp)
```

![map5](tools/img/leaf2_eezboundaries.png)

## Convert to WKT

#### example 1: Marine Ecoregions of the World (MEOW)

**From GeoJSON**

``` r
ecoregions_geoJSON <- mr_geojson(key = "Ecoregions:ecoregions")
ecoregions_wkt_fromGeoJSON <- mr_as_wkt(ecoregions_geoJSON, fmt = 2)
class(ecoregions_wkt_fromGeoJSON)
#> [1] "character"
ecoregions_wkt_fromGeoJSON[1]
#> [1] "MULTIPOLYGON (((170.917 -49.6906,171.563 -50.1232,171.798 -50.4726,172.03 -50.7601,172.182 -51.0473,172.304 -51.2351,172.353 -51.3837,172.387 -51.4418,172.436 -51.7239,172.555 -52.1999,172.571 -52.5695,172.475 -53.3739,172.315 -53.8679,172.134 -54.1382,171.874 -54.586,171.712 -54.7702,171.593 -54.9486,171.358 -55.1618,170.918 -55.4277,170.772 -55.5355,170.614 -55.6107,170.482 -55.6821,170.389 -55.7154,170.229 -55.7576,169.896 -55.8151,169.29 -55.9346,169.155 -55.942,169.064 -55.9396,168.998 -55.9316,168.762 -55.9148,168.552 -55.8905,168.482 -55.8798,167.844 -55.6895,167.754 -55.6715,167.581 -55.5565,167.259 -55.3861,166.944 -55.1303,166.664 -54.9394,166.158 -54.2928,168.737 -49.6441,170.211 -49.6755,170.917 -49.6906),(169.125 -52.5761,169.162 -52.5781,169.186 -52.577,169.226 -52.5653,169.238 -52.5543,169.236 -52.539,169.217 -52.5283,169.21 -52.4858,169.209 -52.4658,169.212 -52.4582,169.208 -52.4442,169.174 -52.4433,169.164 -52.4458,169.003 -52.5042,169 -52.5189,169.008 -52.5361,169.017 -52.5481,169.028 -52.5592,169.113 -52.5742,169.125 -52.5761)))"
```

**From shp object (using the sf package)**

``` r
ecoregions_shp <- mr_shp(key = "Ecoregions:ecoregions", maxFeatures = 50)
ecoregions_shp_geom <- st_geometry(ecoregions_shp)
ecoregions_wkt_fromshp <- st_as_text(ecoregions_shp_geom)
ecoregions_wkt_fromshp[1]
```

*More detailed example using the Black Sea Ecoregion only*

``` r
ecoregions_blacksea <- subset(ecoregions_shp, ecoregions_shp$ecoregion == "Black Sea")
class(ecoregions_blacksea)
#> [1] "sf"         "tbl_df"     "tbl"        "data.frame"

ecoregions_blacksea_geom <- st_geometry(ecoregions_blacksea) 
class(ecoregions_blacksea_geom)
#> [1] "sfc_MULTIPOLYGON" "sfc"

ecoregions_blacksea_wkt <- st_as_text(ecoregions_blacksea_geom)
class(ecoregions_blacksea_wkt)
#> [1] "character"
```

## Gazetteer Record by Name

#### example: High Seas

``` r
highseas_info <- mr_geo_code(place = "High Seas")
class(highseas_info)
#> [1] "data.frame"
str(highseas_info)
#> 'data.frame':    28 obs. of  14 variables:
#>  $ MRGID                     : int  63203 25721 25714 49698 25723 25713 26566 25727 25715 25712 ...
#>  $ gazetteerSource           : chr  "United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea of 10 December 1982" "VLIZ (2020). Intersect of IHO Sea Areas and Exclusive Economic Zones (version 4)   " "VLIZ (2020). Intersect of IHO Sea Areas and Exclusive Economic Zones (version 4)   " "VLIZ (2020). Intersect of IHO Sea Areas and Exclusive Economic Zones (version 4)   " ...
#>  $ placeType                 : chr  "High Seas" "Marine Region" "Marine Region" "Marine Region" ...
#>  $ latitude                  : num  0 11.4 85.1 74.7 11.4 ...
#>  $ longitude                 : num  0 64.03 -7.33 39.36 87.2 ...
#>  $ minLatitude               : num  -90 0.864 72.783 72.102 5.68 ...
#>  $ minLongitude              : num  -180 54.4 -180 33.7 83.4 ...
#>  $ maxLatitude               : num  90 21.8 90 77 18.4 ...
#>  $ maxLongitude              : num  180 70.4 180 44 90.7 ...
#>  $ precision                 : logi  NA NA NA NA NA NA ...
#>  $ preferredGazetteerName    : chr  "High Seas" "High Seas of the Arabian Sea" "High Seas of the Arctic Ocean" "High Seas of the Barentsz Sea" ...
#>  $ preferredGazetteerNameLang: chr  "English" "English" "English" "English" ...
#>  $ status                    : chr  "standard" "standard" "standard" "standard" ...
#>  $ accepted                  : int  63203 25721 25714 49698 25723 25713 26566 25727 25715 25712 ...
```
